name: Locating decimals with 1 or 2 decimal places on a number line

skills.name: Identify where positive numbers with one decimal place lie on a number line
Identify where positive numbers with two decimal places lie on a number line

explanations.A: This would be the value 0.1 where would 0.2 be?
explanations.B: The number line is 1 split into 10 equal parts so each space is worth 0.1. To find where 0.2 is on the numberline, you need to count 2 spaces along from 0 so B is the correct answer.
explanations.C: This would represent the value 0.6! Each space is worth 0.1 so count along from 0 in spaces of 0.1 until you get to the arrow for 0.2
explanations.D: This would represent the value 0.9! Each space is worth 0.1 so count along from 0 in spaces of 0.1 until you get to the arrow for 0.2

explanations.A: This would be the value 0.1 where would 0.4 be?
explanations.B: This would be the value 0.2 where would 0.4 be?
explanations.C: The number line is 1 split into 10 equal parts so each space is worth 0.1. To find where 0.4 is on the numberline, you need to count 4 spaces along from 0 so C is the correct answer.
explanations.D: This would represent the value 0.9! Each space is worth 0.1 so count along from 0 in spaces of 0.1 until you get to the arrow for 0.4

explanations.A: This would be 0.1. If each space is worth 0.1, where is 0.7?
explanations.B: This would be 0.5 We are looking for 0.7...
explanations.C: The number line is 2 split into 20 equal parts, 2 ÷ 20 = 0.1 so each space is worth 0.1. We are looking for 0.7 so we need to count 7 spaces from 0 which is letter C
explanations.D: This would be 1.7! Each space is worth 0.1 so count along from 0 in spaces of 0.1 until you get to the arrow for 0.7

explanations.A: This would be 0.3. If each space is worth 0.1, where is 0.8?
explanations.B: The number line is 2 split into 20 equal parts, 2 ÷ 20 = 0.1 so each space is worth 0.1. We are looking for 0.8 so we need to count 8 spaces from 0 which is letter B
explanations.C: This would be 1.3 We are looking for 0.8...
explanations.D: This would be 1.8 We are looking for 0.8...

explanations.A: This would be 0.53. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.59 be?
explanations.B: This would be 0.55. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.59 be?
explanations.C: This would be 0.56. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.59 be?
explanations.D: The number line is 0.1 split into 10 equal parts, 0.1 ÷ 10 = 0.01 so each space is worth 0.01. We are looking for 0.59 so we need to count 9 spaces from 0.5 which is letter D

explanations.A: The number line is 0.1 split into 10 equal parts, 0.1 ÷ 10 = 0.01 so each space is worth 0.01. We are looking for 0.42 so we need to count 2 spaces from 0.4 which is letter A

explanations.C: This would be 0.46. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.42 be?
explanations.D: This would be 0.49. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.42 be?

explanations.B: The number line is 0.2 split into 20 equal parts, 0.2 ÷ 20 = 0.01 so each space is worth 0.01. We are looking for 0.14 so we need to count 14 spaces from 0 which is letter B

explanations.D: This would be 0.19. Each space is worth 0.01 so where would 0.14 be?

explanations.D: The number line is 0.2 split into 20 equal parts, 0.2 ÷ 20 = 0.01 so each space is worth 0.01. We are looking for 0.28 so we need to count 18 spaces from 0.1 which is letter D

explanations.A: The number line is 5/10 - 3/10 = 2/10 split into 20 equal parts so each part is worth 2/10 ÷ 20 = 1/100 = 0.01. 3/10 = 0.3 so we need to count on one space of 0.01 from 0.3 to get 0.31 therefore A is correct!
explanations.B: This would be 0.35. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.31 be?
explanations.C: This would be 0.41. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.31 be?
explanations.D: This would be 0.43. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.31 be?

explanations.A: This would be 0.63. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.73 be?
explanations.B: This would be 0.7. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.73 be?
explanations.C: The number line is 8/10 - 6/10 = 2/10 split into 20 equal parts so each part is worth 2/10 ÷ 20 = 1/100 = 0.01. 7/10 = 0.7 so we need to count three spaces of 0.01 from 0.7 to get 0.73 therefore C is correct!
explanations.D: This would be 0.78. Each space is worth 0.01 where would 0.73 be?
